etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of a fish with head, body, fins, and tail, stylized into a standard written form over time. The simplified form streamlines the lower strokes and internal details while keeping the recognizable fish outline.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 魚 by reducing the bottom 灬 to a single stroke 一 and compressing interior strokes to lower the stroke count and standardize the component used in many fish-related characters.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃鱼(我喜歡吃魚)。
他在家里养鱼(他在家裡養魚)。
鱼在河里游来游去(魚在河裡遊來遊去)。
examples.pinyin: Yú zài hé lǐ yóu lái yóu qù.
examples.english: Fish swim back and forth in the river.
